titleStmt.title: The Mournful shepherd: or Torment of loving, and not being lov'd again. A song made by a gentleman who dyed for his cruel mistris. : No torment can be found no greater pain ... : To a pleasant new tune, called Could man his wish obtain, &c. : Play'd and sung at the King's Play-House.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for P. Brooksby, at the sign of the Golden-Ball, in Pye-Corner.,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library.
